response: "{ \"title\": \"Harshad Number Checker\", \"description\": \"A Harshad number, also known as a Niven number, is an integer that is divisible by the sum of its digits when written in a given base. For example, 18 is a Harshad number because it can be divided by the sum of its digits (9). Write a function `is_harshad` that checks if a given integer is a Harshad number.\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef is_harshad(n: int) -> bool:\\n```\\n\\n#### Input\\n- `n` (int): An integer that may be positive or negative.\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Returns `True` if the input integer is a Harshad number, `False` otherwise.\", \"code\": \"import math\\ndef is_harshad(n: int) -> bool:\\n    if n < 0:\\n        return False\\n    sum_of_digits = sum(int(digit) for digit in str(abs(n)))\\n    return n % sum_of_digits == 0\\n\", \"tests\": [\"assert is_harshad(18) == True\", \"assert is_harshad(-18) == False\", \"assert is_harshad(12) == True\", \"assert is_harshad(-36) == True\"] }"
